titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Earl Casey Accessions
titlestmt.author: Sherri Turner-Herrmann

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-08-23 12:54:02 -0500.

change.item: Revised for ArchivesSpace by Sherri Turner-Herrmann

did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Earl Casey Accessions

physdesc.extent: Audio and digital files on cassette tapes and thumb drives

did.physloc: Materials may be stored off-site. Advance notice is required for use: https://www.thewittliffcollections.txstate.edu/research/makearesearchappointment.html.
did.abstract: This collection consists of research documents and taped interviews with transcipts conducted with Jerry Jeff Walker, Walker's family, friends and other musicians. Materials were compiled by Earl Casey as research for the book Gypsy Songman.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research excluding Box 3664-NOTE: BOX 3664 FOLDER 1 IS RESTRICTED UNTIL 2035 WITHOUT CURATOR OR DIRECTOR'S PERMISSION.

bioghist.head: Biographical Notes
bioghist.p: Earl Casey is a journalist, former CNN senior vice president and longtime close friend of Jerry Jeff and Susan Walker. Casey served as the chief researcher and writer/consultant on Jerry Jeff Walker's autobiograpy, Gypsy Songman, 1999.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Earl Casey Accessions, The Wittliff Collections, Texas State University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Archival materials received from journalist and former CNN senior vice president, Earl Casey. Casey, a longtime friend of Jerry Jeff and Susan Walker, served as the chief researcher and writer/consultant on Jerry Jeff Walker's autobiograpy, Gypsy Songman, 1999. The bulk of the material in this collection dates 1964-1990 and consists of research documents and taped interviews with transcipts conducted with Jerry Jeff Walker, Walker's family, friends and other musicians for the book Gypsy Songman. Research documents include photocopies of Walker's arrest records for his infamous, 1964 New Orleans public intoxication charge, correspondence between Walker, his family and friends, newspaper clippings pertaining to Walker's childhood in Oneonta, New York and his subsequent musical career, a PhD dissertation pertaining to the songs of Jerry Jeff Walker, photographs, drawings, partial draft manuscript for Letters from the Road (original working title for Gypsy Songman) and a copy of Ben Jennings' unpublished memoir. Color coded stickers on cassette tapes and transcripts along with color coded spreadsheet reflect Casey's original numbering system. Folder titles preceding a semicolon reflect Casey's original descriptions. NOTE: BOX 3664 FOLDER 1 IS RESTRICTED UNTIL 2035 WITHOUT CURATOR OR DIRECTOR'S PERMISSION.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Materials from the Wittliff Collections are made available for use in research, teaching, and private study. The user assumes responsibility for determining copyright status, obtaining permission to publish, and abiding by U.S. copyright laws. https://www.thewittliffcollections.txstate.edu/research/visit/policies/publication.html

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: The Wittliff Collections also holds the Jerry Jeff Walker collection (TMC 047) as well as the following accessions relating to Jerry Jeff Walker within the Texas Music Collection - 2021 -064,2021-056, 2021-090, 2021-091

did.unittitle: Accession 2021-094

physdesc.extent: Audio and digital files on cassette tapes and thumb drives

did.abstract: Archival materials received from journalist and former CNN senior vice president, Earl Casey. Casey, a longtime friend of Jerry Jeff and Susan Walker, served as the chief researcher and writer/consultant on Jerry Jeff Walker's autobiograpy, Gypsy Songman, 1999. The bulk of the material in this collection dates 1964-1990 and consists of research documents and taped interviews with transcipts conducted with Jerry Jeff Walker, Walker's family, friends and other musicians for the book Gypsy Songman. Research documents include photocopies of Walker's arrest records for his infamous, 1964 New Orleans public intoxication charge, correspondence between Walker, his family and friends, newspaper clippings pertaining to Walker's childhood in Oneonta, New York and his subsequent musical career, a PhD dissertation pertaining to the songs of Jerry Jeff Walker, photographs, drawings, partial draft manuscript for Letters from the Road (original working title for Gypsy Songman) and a copy of Ben Jennings' unpublished memoir. Color coded stickers on cassette tapes and transcripts along with color coded spreadsheet reflect Casey's original numbering system. Folder titles preceding a semicolon reflect Casey's original descriptions. NOTE: BOX 3664 FOLDER 1 IS RESTRICTED UNTIL 2035 WITHOUT CURATOR OR DIRECTOR'S PERMISSION.

did.unittitle: "Jerry Jeff Walker-New Orleans Police Arrest Blotters 1964-1965 (File N.O. Public Library) -Photocopy: Arrest Index Cards 1964-1965"; Photocopies of New Orleans , LA Police arrest blotters and index cards for Jerry Jeff Walker's Public Drunkenness charge, letter to Earl Casey from Wayne Everard, Archivist, New Orleans Public Library

"Jerry Jeff Walker Letters: jack Frazier/'60's New Orleans : Harry Stoneback (Stoney) Photo: Ryder Coffee House"; Photograph of the Ryder Coffee House, New Orleans, LA with note to Earl Casey from Jack Frazier on back, letter to Casey from H.R. "Stoney" Stoneback regarding Jerry Jeff Walker's birthday concert, letters to Jerry Jeff Walker and Earl Casey from Jack Frazier regarding 1960's New Orleans and the Ryder Coffee House, letter to Pierre De Gruy, editor of Gambit regarding early 1960's New Orleans and the Ryder Coffee House/Lee Harvey Oswald connection

"Jerry Jeff Walker Oneonta Newspaper, Library Clippings"; Newspaper clippings from Binghamton Press, The Daily Star and The Oneonta Star newspapers, Oneonta, New York, with stories of Jerry Jeff Walker's (Ron Crosby) Oneonta High School basketball team, The Chymes recording contract, Clyde Conrow's death, Oneonta High School yearbook pages and photocopies of family photographs

"Photos - AP Wide World 1962 Ft. Lauderdale-others"; Anne Edwards 35mm color slides (5) of Jerry Jeff Walker on railroad tracks in Oneonta, Jerry Jeff Walker Spring Break Ft. Lauderdale B/W 8x10 photograph 4x6 reprint of Jerry Jeff Walker's mother in Oneonta singing group, photocopies of Fayetteville, Arkansas High School yearbook- Jerry Jeff Walkers first professional gig, Faces of Austin brochure, Texas Monthly magazine -Jerry Jeff Walker cover, pg. 78, People magazine - Jerry Jeff Walker and family, pg. 81
"Jerry Jeff Walker Jerry Jeff Draft Chapter For Autobiography"; Handwritten draft

"Jerry Jeff Walker Burton's Book of Blues - Photos of JJW at Armadillo 1971"; 3 B/W, 8x10 Burt Wilson photographs of Jerry Jeff Walker at the Armadillo World Headquarters, Austin, Texas, letter to Earl Casey from Burton Wilson, piece written by Wilson pertaining to Casey's research for Jerry Jeff Walker book, printout on Wilson's obituary, photocopies of articles on Burton Wilson and the 1970's Austin music scene, 1 copy of Burton's Book of the Blues, signed and inscribed by Burton Wilson
"Jerry Jeff Walker Ben Jennings Sketches Letters and Some Other "Art" Notes"; Pencil and pen and ink sketches of Jerry Jeff Walker by Ben Jennings, correspondence between Earl Casey and Ben Jennings

"Jerry Jeff Walker Rafe Blaugrund -Clippings-Dissertation (USB Drive)"; The Country Road to the Unconscious: Early Childhood Conflict in the Songs of Jerry Jeff Walker, dissertation by Rafe Blaugrund, email to Earl Casey from Katy Tucker, Librarian, Union Institute & University, Cincinnati, Ohio, notes, letter to Susan and JJW from Earl Casey regarding Blaugrund's research, photocopies of newspaper clippings pertaining to JJW, USB drive. File 1 of 2

"Jerry Jeff Walker Rafe Blaugrund Clippings"; Photocopies of newspaper clippings pertaining to JJW-research for Blaugrund's dissertation on JJW, The Country Road to the Unconscious: Early Childhood Conflict in the Songs of Jerry Jeff Walker. File 2 of 2

Letters from the Road by Jerry Jeff Walker. Photocopy of original draft of the first half of book, pp. 10274m 1-10. Letters from the Road is the original working title for Gypsy Songman by Jerry Jeff Walker, published 1999

Interview "Pat Kenney NYC 9-11-90"; Owner, Kenney's Castaways, NYC. Booked Jerry Jeff Walker in 70s in NY, close friend, Side A, Side B blank, TDK D90 cassette tape
Interview "Dan Elliot 9/13/90 NYC 60's": Booker, owner, agent. Met Jerry Jeff Walker and band early Lost Sea Dreamers days NYC, Side A, Side B blank. TDK D90 cassette tape
Interview "Sally Ann Mitchell 1 + 2 7-9-90"; Serious Jerry Jeff Walker love figure, 1965. Letters, detail. "Morning Song to Sally", Side A and B. Sony UX-S 90 cassette tape
Interview "Sally Ann Mitchell 3 7-9-90"; Serious Jerry Jeff Walker love figure, 1965. Letters, detail. "Morning Song to Sally", Side A, Side B blank. Sony UX-S 90 cassette tape

Interview "Rod Kennedy 8/22/90"; Met Jerry Jeff Walker before Circus Maximus, 11th door, Chequered Flag. Side A and B Austin 60's, Kerryville Folkfest (See Also Alan Damron, Segle Fry). Maxwell XLII 90 cassette tape

Interview "Utah Phillips/Ramblin' Jack 3-18-90"; Phillips performer, historian, much background on evolution of folk-country. Ramblin' Jack Elliot, legend. Knew Jerry Jeff Walker NYC and Early Dallas-Austin, Side A, Side B blank. Maxwell UDII 90 cassette tape
Interview "Jay Vurhultz [sic] 8-9-90 Austin Years"; Late 1964, first met Jerry Jeff Walker at the Id, New Orleans and 11th Door, Side A and B. Maxwell XLII 90 cassette tape
Interview "Pat Verhultz 8-9-90 (Austin years: See Jay Verhultz)"; Former wife of Jay Verhultz, early Austin details, Side A and B, Maxwell XLII 90 cassette tape
Interview "-JJW + Michael Martin Murphy -Michael Martin Murphy"; Side A Jerry Jeff Walker and Murphy McDonald's Memories, Side B Murphy great detail on early Austin era. Maxwell XLII 90 cassette tape
Interview "Michael Martin Murphy"; Side A Taos, great detail on early Austin era, Side B blank. TDK D90 cassette tape
Interview "Ray Wylie Hubbard"; Singer-songwriter, wrote Redneck Mother, Side A, Side B blank. TDK D90 cassette tape
Interview "Gary P. Nunn"; Lost Gonzo Band, Jan 1972 with Michael Martin Murphy. "London Homesick Blues", Side A and B. Maxwell XLII 90 cassette tape
Interview "Craig Hillis 8/24/90"; Lost Gonzo Band, Jan 1972 with Michael Martin Murphy, Side A and B. Maxwell XLII 90 cassette tape
Interview "John Inmon 12/16/88"; Lost Gonzo Band, guitar impresario, Austin: Steamboat Springs Side A and B. Memorex dBS 90 cassette tape
Interview "Freddy KRC"; Steady Freddy, drummer, singer. Brief story told. Side A "Freddy Kirk: The Vegas Move 8/20/90"; Side B blank. Maxell XLII 90
Interview "Eddie Wilson"; Armadillo World Headquarters founder, Jerry Jeff Walker memory, some critical, Side A and B. Maxell XLII 90 cassette tape
Interview "Steve Fromholtz 12-15-88"; Wild man, Texas State student with Michael Martin Murphy, great history '69+. Side A and B. Maxell XLII 90 cassette tape
Interview "Walt Garrison 9/27/90"; Rodeo icon, very brief knockdown story, Side A, Side B blank. TDK D90 cassette tape

Liquid Lace (An Opus): memoirs of a Self-Proclaimed Romantic - Photocopied manuscript of unpublished autobiography of Ben Jennings, good friend of Jerry Jeff Walker. Pp. 1-216 and 6 pages of photos. RESTRICTED UNTIL 2035 WITHOUT CURATOR OR DIRECTOR'S PERMISSION
